Sequence Information.Peptide Name: (I5,R8) Mastoparan ([I5,R8] MP, Mastoparan-L analog, Synthetic AMPs, Leu-rich, XXA, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: designed, amino acid substitution, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (85.71%) toMastoparan-LL: 29%, I=K: 21%, A: 14%.Activity: Active against Gram- E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 12.5 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 6.25 uM), K. pneumoniae ATCC 13883 (MIC 6.25 uM), A. baumannii ATCC 19606 (MIC 3 uM), Gram+ S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 25 uM), S. pyogenes ATCC 19615 (MIC 6.25 uM), L. ivanovii Li 4pVS2 (MIC 50 uM), E.faecalis ATCC 29212 (MIC >100 uM),fungi C. albicans ATCC 90028 (MIC 12.5 uM), and C. parapsilosis ATCC 22019 (MIC 25 uM).Virus: Inhibited entry of Human alphaherpesvirus 1 (HSV-1) (EC50 6.22 uM).In vitro toxicity: rat RBC: HC50 > 200 uM, poor hemo.lytic. THP-1-derived macrophages (IC50 24..5 uM0, and HEK-293 (IC50 > 200 uM).MOA:bacteria:E. coli: MOA:bacteria:S. aureus: membrane permeation and depolarization.SAR: C-terminal amidation increased peptide activity.
Literature Information.Author: Irazazabal LN, Porto WF, Ribeiro SM, Casale S, Humblot V, Ladram A, Franco OL. 2016
Literature Information.Title: Selective amino acid substitution reduces cytotoxicity of the antimicrobial peptide mastoparan.
